line-11: Who are we looking for? We are looking for someone with extensive experience planning, leading, delivering and coordinating major high profile events, a solid understanding of major incident management on the railway and demonstrable experience managing and engaging with stakeholders at all levels. What does the average day look like? Event Planning: Supporting the industry by either leading or coordinating planning for major planned events to prepare the rail industry for these events, mitigating dependency issues (e.g. with engineering works), security risks and the impact on passengers and freight. Such events include cultural events, events involving high-profile rail travel, sporting events and music events. Stakeholder Management: You will be dealing with a large number of internal and external stakeholders often providing the national point of contact for major event planning. This includes strategic and tactical stakeholders across Network Railâ€™s regions and national functions, Train and Freight Operators, Emergency Services, Local Resilience Forums, Government and the Royal Household. Exercising and Lesson Learning: You will be overseeing the programme of national exercising and supporting regions and routes with local exercising. This includes table-top exercises and live-exercising, working closely with regional and route leads to provide support as appropriate and taking the learning from exercises and enabling effective lesson sharing and imbedding across the industry. This includes exercising planned events and spontaneous incidents, emergencies, major incidents and crises. Emergency Assurance: Establish and assure a national emergency management testing framework. Collaborate with regions, central functions, and emergency services to fortify our resilience, ensuring a swift response to major disruptive events. Benefits Navigator: Identify, plan, and track the business benefits of our national exercise and testing program. Align with strategic objectives, national resilience processes, and project requirements to instill confidence in each plan. Ultimately your role and the team help support improved operational preparedness, operational resilience and emergency management to avoid or mitigate the safety and performance risks to passengers, freight and staff.
